gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.diagram.jfreechart
Class Chart

java.lang.Object
  gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.diagram.jfreechart.Chart

public class Chart
extends java.lang.Object

A chart based on JFreeChart.

Author:
andreou

Method Detail

getJFreeChart

public JFreeChart getJFreeChart()
Returns the JFreeChart that supports this chart.

newPanel

public ChartPanel newPanel()
Creates a panel with this chart embedded, which can be used in a Swing application.

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                  double width,
                  double height)
Draws this chart on a Graphics2D object. The chart will scale itself to fit in the region (0, 0), (width, height).

Parameters:
g - the graphics object to draw with
width - the width of the drawn chart
height - the height of the drawn chart

newImage

public java.awt.image.BufferedImage newImage(int width,
                                             int height)
Creates an image containing this chart.

Parameters:
width - the width of the image and the chart in it
height - the height of the image and the chart in it

write

public void write(int width,
                  int height,
                  java.lang.String format,
                  java.io.File file)
           throws java.io.IOException
Writes the chart as an image to a file. The format of the image (e.g., "jpeg") is specified as in ImageIO.write(java.awt.image.RenderedImage, String, OutputStream).

Parameters:
width - the width of the image written to file
height - the height of the image written to file
format - the format with which to encode the image (e.g., "jpeg")
file - the file on which to write the image
Throws:
java.io.IOException

write

public void write(int width,
                  int height,
                  java.lang.String format,
                  java.io.OutputStream out)
           throws java.io.IOException
Writes the chart as an image to an output stream. The format of the image (e.g., "jpeg") is specified as in ImageIO.write(java.awt.image.RenderedImage, String, OutputStream).

Parameters:
width - the width of the image written to file
height - the height of the image written to file
format - the format with which to encode the image (e.g., "jpeg")
out - the output stream to which to write the image
Throws:
java.io.IOException
